meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>angry</kanji>, the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to get angry</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: You're starting <vocabulary>to get angry</vocabulary> about something. It's mostly this <reading>ok</reading>ra (おこ). It tastes terrible.
